job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Lisa Davis our current CEO is amazing! During the COVID19 outbreak she has really showed that each and every employee matters! She is making sure that everyone is taken care of. She has gone out of her way to help NTSOC and our clients. Without leadership like her we would not survive. Thank you Lisa for all you do for the company and for each one of us personally!
cons: I have seen a lot of changes in the past six months and they all have been for the good!

review_title: Wonderful company and CEO who truly cares!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Upon joining the company, the CEO took time to meet with me my first week to ensure that I was doing okay and adapting well. The company culture is very evident and everyone is always friendly and willing to help! Even with the Covid pandemic, the company never turned their backs on their employees.
cons: None to name, or can think of!

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Excellent place to work.  All jobs come with a few challenges.  NTSOC has a customer service attitude.
cons: Sometimes it can take a few days to get answers to questions.  Not really an issue.  If its critical, the answer comes fast.

review_title: The people I work with are the best. Great team effort all the way around.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: 2 weeks paid vacations from day 1, Paid holidays, weekends off, no work after hours.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Shenandoah, IA
cons: very low pay without any raises
This is a culture of fear.

pros: Strong physicians clinic with good OB Program strong nursing staff who cares about patients safety and outcomes.
cons: The organization structure is very management heavy with no management left from the area. All senior managers have been turned over in the last two years and outside management brought in resulting in a fear culture of 25% turnover in employees. Micro management and fear rule the culture and provide for no employee satisfaction or engagement.

pros: Great people in all working departments
cons: Terrible management. CEO has issues and needs to learn to lead by example instead of by fear tactics.

pros: Decent Pay, Managers leave very early on Fridays
